channel.title: How do i make a local area connection
channel.description:
first things first. windows xp 2002 service pack 3, dell inspiron mini and im connected to my internet through wireless.
so i dint have ebough money for a wireless thing for my xbox so i was going to do it through my computer connect my computer to my xbox with a cat5 cable and bridge my wireless connection and my local area connection buutttttt. my damn computer decides to not have a local area connection only a wirless thing in the network options so how do i make one or if it there how do i make it visible? DO NOT TELL ME TO CLICK ON MAKE A NEW CONNECTION because i have done that with the fucking setup wizard 100 times and it doesnt work. so yea help pleass!!!
and the reason i cant connect my xbox to the router is because its in my aunts room and she would say no.

item.title: How do i make a local area connection
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.source: How do i make a local area connection

item.title: How do i make a local area connection
item.dc:creator: @deans1243 deans1243
item.description:
@deans1243 wrote:

yea i figured it out about 10 minutes after posting this i had to enable my realtek controller or some shit and it made a local connection for me haâ€¦ but yea 2 bar connection on black ops it kinda sucks

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make a local area connection

item.title: How do i make a local area connection
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

is the cat5 a crossover cable? if not u need a crossover cable to do this. ive connected my 360 to xbox live via my phone data plan slow and i never played a game on xbox live but ive played pc games on it.

edit:

u go to the already created LAN connection, right click open properties. enable sharing internet through this connection or w/e it says there. thats all i had to do. u can also bridge the WLAN and LAN connections. idk there is a couple ways to do it.

there should be a LAN connection there automatically, if there isnt idk what to say except google the problem. make sure ur computer recognizes the wired NIC u have u may try to uninstall the driver to ur ethernet and have windows automatically install it.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make a local area connection
